comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20110902 Firefox/6.0.2 SeaMonkey/2.3.3
Build ID: 20110902182936

Steps to reproduce:

Opened download manager with ^J with the only download option set is "Don't open anything" and do a download.  When the download finishes the download manager window comes into focus.    Download Manager is open so downloads can be monitored.


Actual results:

After a download finishes the download manager window comes into focus even though the only option set is "Don't open anything".  The download manager is taking focus from the current window when it is not supposed to do anything.

In 2.0.14 the download manager does not come into focus.  Which is the expected behavior.  In 2.3.3 when each file is finished the download manager pops into focus.  In 2.0.14 if the "Flash ..." option was set the download manager would flash in as expected.


Expected results:

The download manager should have simply updated the screen and not changed the focus since it was not told to flash the screen.  This current behavior makes using the download manager annoying since other work is being done while waiting for the downloads to finish and if a number of downloads are being down the focus disappears from where it is supposed to be as each download finishes.

System is Slackware 13.0 Linux using the FVWM 2 Window Manager with 96 window view ports.

Linux saia 2.6.29.6-smp #2 SMP Mon Dec 7 16:02:16 CST 2009 i686 AMD Athlon(tm) XP 1800+ AuthenticAMD GNU/Linux

Bug 143267 may be related since it tries to address a failure to come into focus when it is supposed to come into focus.  This is an issue where the windows is not supposed to come into focus.
